The leveling order doesn't really matter; start with rogue 3 for the extra skill points then just make sure you end up with Rogue 8 / Bard 12 pre-epic (taking bard feats on bard levels). Post epic, take Imp Evasion and Defensive roll as your rogue bonus feats and Epic Dodge as your general feat at 30. Great Dex could be replaced with something if you wanted to; just makes your Dex score even. Since it's mostly a team-playing support build, you could take out Blindfight for something else as well. Also, you would have Spellcraft bonus to saves (not shown in stats).

Using Halfling instead of Goblin just means you have 2 more points in STR (to avoid the damage penalty early on) and INT or CON. For a finished build, Halfling would obviously be the better choice, and Elf would probably be best of all for Longbows. So feel free to swap in a different race; this is just what I'm using for a Goblin.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: Halfling means 2 more Cha which is important to a bard build. With that goblin you are giving up on lvl 5-6 bardic spells which is a pity. I'd go halfling and sling (+1 AB from good aim and +2 AC plus enchantment from large shield) and get craft wand in btw.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Atypical wrote:
Arelith-specific, but since it's a 2-class split the 3 lvl requirement shouldn't have much of an effect on anything.
But if it is for Arelith, that would rule out a single fighter class for 2 more useful feats or SD for HiPS (a few examples) while retaining all the ED goodness, which would not be the case elsewhere. A 2-class split limitation was not clear as a prereq in your original post.

I agree with Kail, though. A slinger makes more sense to me as well. If you are settled on the giggles of a goblin bard then you will pay the price for the amusement factor, not a max build but rather a RP one.

Nonetheless, by taking Grt Dex at Lvl 24 then Def Roll at Lvl 25 you can get ED at Lvl 27. That would leave EP at Lvl 30.

Also, I would spread the bard levels more evenly to get regular Spellcraft dumps and perhaps make it a taunter though you will again be paying for the goblin -CHA deal. Regardless, max spell level aside, this toon will be limited to robes to use arcane casting unless via items.
